lines.text:
[at different times]
Remember Mr. So-And-So, remember, I'm a lady.
[after Anne wakes up the household with her screaming]
A nightmare. She was having a nightmare.
I thought someone was killing her.

[about her mother]
We have nothing in common. She just doesn't understand me. Whenever I try to explain my views on life to her she asks me if I'm constipated.
We are all here, alive. That's present enough.

[reading a note on a present from Anne]
You've never lost your temper. You never will I fear. You're so good, but if you should, put all your cross words here.
We don't need the Nazis to destroy us. We're destroying ourselves.
